SENT.plain: INTRODUCTION: BehÃ§et's disease is a multi-system vascular-inflammatory disease with possible involvement of the central nervous system
Lesions of the corpus callosum on MRI have been rarely reported in this disease
CASE REPORT: A 47-year-old woman was admitted for a sudden right hemiplegia and confusion revealing a Behcet's disease
MRI showed a pedonculo-thalamic lesion and a white matter hypersignals, which was suggestive of the disease
Besides, involvement of the corpus callosum was observed
CONCLUSION: This case demonstrates that Behcet's disease should be considered among diseases with corpus callosum involvement
